is kind of equal

second know your target audience and

for a test you would use academic
english but also

native speakers i would use easier vocab
i would use some examples that people

not just people who are based in like
bay area where i am right now so it's
very important to be relatable in your

think about this end person you're

understand what you're writing about in

don't try to over complicate your
example over complicate them if that is

whatever
for admissions purposes but if you're
writing a general text even if you're

try to make it interesting to read try
to make it relatable don't over
complicate and it's also a great test on

if you don't understand what's going on
you won't be able to explain it in
simple terms keep it simple sometimes we
just try to include so many words uh
that sound advanced to us but sometimes

then there's a lot of confusion around
that i would really recommend to keep it
simple in terms of vocabulary but also
again if you're writing a test
they would actually look at whether
you're using introductory words or
phrasal verbs then use them but don't
try to use words that you don't
understand 100
don't overuse the word to be
let me give you an example he is
handsome he is an engineer devoted to
his work doesn't this sound like
these two phrases were written by a
child or a robot instead of using to be
in both sentences we can also do it this
way the handsome engineer devotes
himself to his work so what you're doing
here is changing the subject of the
sentence to avoid using to be all the
time another uh thing that i always see
in text is when you start with i every
single sentence like i'm writing to ask
about this i'm working on this project i
was thinking maybe you would be
interested again change the subject of
the sentence go from yourself to another
person what value are they getting from
reading your email or text how you can
be helpful to them and this would help
you avoid using i at the beginning of
every single sentence keep it positive
like there is so much negativity in this
world that you just
want to be positive even when you're
writing things let's compare two

unbelievable would not occur and the
second sentence is i thought the
unbelievable would happen there is a

sentence because there is too much
negation
uh in one sentence we have i did not

starting to get confused don't do that
in your text
keep it simple keep it positive the next
tip is to hook your readers at the

when i wrote my latest email on substack
i started it with graham stefan makes
500.000 a month on youtube in this

he does it so it was something similar
so it's very important to
hook
your audience with something intriguing
but also to reveal the topic of the
whole text with this phrase it is really
important because the attention span
these days is really short and when
people are scrolling through your feed
for example if you're writing on
instagram your first sentence should be
a hook for everyone to continue reading
because otherwise they would just scroll
down same applies to essays the same
applies to emails etc learn how to
organize a paragraph because within a
paragraph you also have a structure you

main thought then you have your
arguments or supporting sentences then
you have your conclusion and summarize
your ideas learn transitions this is
what test makers are looking for all of
those connecting words moreover
by the way in addition to first of all
like learn of those phrases and use them
get rid of fillers the less words you
have the better for example beginner
writers would say in order to do
something then advanced writers would
just say two
do something so you avoided two extra
words and you saved people's time and
they would appreciate it don't use very

when you feel this urge to say very or

of a stronger synonym that will replace
these two words with one word and make
your text a lot more convincing use data
oh my god if you have access to data if

it's just i don't the way it works is

practice makes perfect the more you

you know
zero mistakes beautiful vocabulary etc
